question: I am 24, live in England with my partner and 5 year old son, and am currently studying for a degree at University. I get undergraduate student finance, and my partner works full time. . Can I apply for a grant to cover the cost of childcare for my son whilst I attend my course?
Answers:
yes Conditions:
  • your childcare provider is on the Ofsted Early Years Register or General Childcare Register - check with your provider
  • neither you or your partner are claiming Tax-Free Childcare, the childcare element of working Tax Credit or Universal Credit
  • neither you or your partner receive help with childcare costs from the National Health Service (NHS)
  • you’re not getting a Postgraduate Loan
  • the children in your grant application are financially dependent on you
  • if your child is cared for at home, the carer cannot be a relative and must be registered with an appropriate body - check with Student Finance England

question: My husband and I are both retired and on a low income, so we get pension credit. However, we had some savings so we also get savings credit. . Are we eligible for the warm home discount even though we receive savings credit?
Answers:
yes Conditions:
  • your energy supplier is part of the scheme
  • your name (or your partner’s) is on the bill

question: I have been off work with mental health issues for the past 27 weeks. Work will only pay me SSP for another week. . What will happen to me SSP after this date?
Answers: apply for universal credit or employment and support allowance (esa).

question: I am seventy five years old and although I am in reasonably good health I would like to ensure that in the event of my death my dependants are provided for as I would wish. I have several properties including some overseas. . What is the first thing I need to think about when making a will?
Answers: get advice if your will is not straightforward

question: I married a man two months ago after living in England for four years. I found out that the man has a STD and had it at the time of our wedding, so I'd like to annul our marriage. . Can I apply for an annulment and how much will it cost?

My brother has not been seen since an earthquake whilst he was on holiday abroad two years ago. He has an estate in the UK I would like to administer for his children. . Is it possible for me to declare my brother dead even though he's only been missing two years?
Answers:
yes Conditions:
  • less than 7 years and you think they’ve died, for example they went missing during a natural disaster

question: My dad has bipolar disorder and I have to care for him. This usually takes around 25 hours per week. I have just been on a 6 week holiday where someone else stepped in and did the caring for me. . Am I still eligible for the Carers Credit whilst on holiday?

My grandmother own a big property worthy over £1million and her healthy has deteroriated and lost memory. She is now in a nursing home and i am afraid that some of my family members are posing a real threat to change her will . I feel very worried and i want to protect her interests despite her condition. . Can i seek a court protection order without informing my other family members?
My niece is 19 years old and has a 2 year old baby. She wants to join Bath university for her pharmacy degree but needs support with her baby. . Can she qualify for Care to Learn?

My partner and I are in the middle of an acrimonious separation. We both work full time but he earns more than I do. I cannot afford to pay the mortgage alone. . Where can I get advice about my situation?

My uncle recently died and I was given responsibility to value the estate. The estate is worth above £350,000 and will be passed to his son . Does the son have to pay inheritance tax or any taxes on the estate ?

We are a couple aged 60 and 62, living in England. We own our home outright with no mortgage and would like to gift it to our son and his wife. We will still live there and will pay all the bills connected to the property. My son and his wife would move into annexe. . Would we have to pay rent to our son in addition to paying the bills?

I was getting income support until last month. I have got a full time now and will be joining next week. Also, I want some money to cover my house costs. Previously I was claiming support for mortgage interest. . As I am moving to a full time role, will I be eligible to apply for Mortgage Interest Run On?
Answers:
yes Conditions:
  • you’ve been claiming the benefit continuously for at least 26 weeks
  • you expect the work (or more money) to last for 5 weeks or more
  • you were entitled to help with your housing costs before your work started and you’ll still have these costs when you start work

question: I recently separated from my husband and i am the custodian of my two children.My situation has changed and my working hours have reduced to 15 hours per week. . How much benefits will i get for my two children who are 5 and 10 years old respectively?
Answers:
£21.15 a week Conditions: Eldest or only child | £21.15

If a family splits up, you get £21.15 a week for the eldest child.

question: My mother was detained in a psychiatric hospital for treatment after sectioning one month ago. I feel she is well enough now and I want her to be discharged. . Can I apply for her discharge as her nearest relative?
Answers:
yes Conditions:

There are deadlines for the first time you apply - you must apply within:

  • 6 months if you’ve been admitted for treatment (‘section 3’)

question: I am originally  from USA and was working in Uk. My  health has deteroriated after a long battle with diabetes and has affected my eyesight and making it difficult to continue with my work. . How much can I claim from PIP?
Answers: the weekly rate for the daily living part of pip is either £60.00 or £89.60.

question: My mother was diagnosed with dementia four years ago, and is currently being cared for in a nursing home. Her former partner, who has a conviction for domestic violence against her, is now requesting to see her "to make amends". . Given the considerable distress this prospect has caused my mother, can I get an order preventing such visits?

I am pregnant with my first child and I currently claim universal credit. I live in England. I want to find out if there is any additional support for me and the baby available. . How much is the Sure Start Maternity Grant?

I'm 54, and 6 months ago I was diagnosed with mesothelioma as a result of asbestos exposure when employed between 2001 and 2005. I've looked into making a civil claim against my former employer, but the company appears to no longer exist and their (former) insurers are also untraceable. . Am I still entitled to compensation from the state even if I cannot trace my former employer?
Answers:
yes Conditions:
  • are not entitled to a payment under the 1979 Pneumoconiosis Act
  • have not been given a payment for the disease from an employer, a civil claim or elsewhere
  • are not entitled to compensation from a Ministry of Defence scheme
  • your mesothelioma was caused by exposure to asbestos when working in the UK

question: I am doing a part-time carer job for about 22 hours a week and I also get a property and a share income of £20000 per annum . Will I be eligible for Carer's Credit ?

Answers:
yes Conditions:
  • Income Support
  • income-based Jobseeker’s Allowance
  • income-related Employment and Support Allowance
  • Pension Credit

question: I am 19 years old and have just started a degree course at University for a Higher National Diploma. I have Asperger . Does my disability entitle me to claim DSA?
Answers:
yes Conditions:
  • qualify for student finance from Student Finance England
  • be studying on a course that lasts at least a year

question: I am 6 months pregnant with my first child and I need money to cater for my health and prepare for my baby arrival. . Am I allowed to apply for any form of maternity allowances?
Answers:
yes Conditions:
  • you or your partner already get certain benefits
  • Income Support
  • income-based Jobseeker’s Allowance
  • income-related Employment and Support Allowance
  • Pension Credit
  • Child Tax Credit
  • Working Tax Credit that includes a disability or severe disability element
  • Universal Credit

    • You may also qualify if you’re getting a Support for Mortgage Interest loan.

question: My aunt health has quickly deteriorated and she no longer has the mental capacity to make decisions. Family members keep visiting to ask her for money and I believe they are taking advantage of her. . How long do I have to confirm that I have told people about my application?
Answers: within 7 days of sending the forms

question: I am in receipt of Universal Credit for a chronic health condition. I receive PIP but only on the lower level of the daily living component. . Can my partner be registered as my carer given that I do not qualify for higher level PIP?
Answers:
yes Conditions:
  • you’ve been in England, Scotland or Wales for at least 2 of the last 3 years (this does not apply if you’re a refugee or have humanitarian protection status)
  • you normally live in England, Scotland or Wales, or you live abroad as a member of the armed forces (you might still be eligible if you’re moving to or already living in an EEA country or Switzerland)
  • you’re not in full-time education
  • you’re not studying for 21 hours a week or more
  • you’re not subject to immigration control
  • your earnings are £128 or less a week after tax, National Insurance and expenses
  • you’re 16 or over
  • you spend at least 35 hours a week caring for someone

question: I am 52, and the appointed Personal Welfare deputy of my 75 year old father, who has dementia. He also has a Panel Deputy, appointed by the court, to handle his financial affairs. My father's current will divides his estate equally between myself and two siblings; however, my younger brother was recently convicted of an extremely serious criminal offense which would very likely have caused my father to disinherit him. . Can I apply to change my father's will, or is this a matter for the deputy handling his financial affairs?
Answers:
yes Conditions:

Someone who has lost the mental capacity to manage their finances may still have the ability to make a will. A solicitor will usually be able to tell you if they are.

You’ll also need to prove to the Court of Protection that the person is not able to make a will by themselves.

question: I am a landlord and i took a loan to repair my entire home and my tenants are not paying their rents promptly due to covid pandemic . I am now financially struggling. . Can i get financial help to cushion my mortgage interest?

yes Conditions:
  • Income Support
  • income-based Jobseeker’s Allowance (JSA)
  • income-related Employment and Support Allowance (ESA)
  • Universal Credit
  • Pension Credit

    • You might still be able to get SMI if you apply for one of the qualifying benefits but cannot get it because your income is too high. You’ll then be treated as getting the benefit you applied for.

question: I am going back to full time work after two years of unemployment due to ill health. My mortgage and expenses have been paid by benefits during this time. . How long can I get help for after my main benefits stop?

He has since neglected us and i would like him to pay up for child mantainance. . Is there a court order which can obtained to make my husband pay child mantainance?

Answers: if the judge agrees, the court will send you and your husband or wife a certificate. this may take several weeks.

question: I own a home with a mortgage with my wife. 4 months ago my hours reduced to just 10 hours per week due to coronavirus and I had to start claiming Income Support and Support for Mortgage Interest. Now my hours have increased to 40 per week again. . Can I claim Mortgage Interest Run On?

Answers:
yes Conditions:
  • have had difficulties with daily living or getting around (or both) for 3 months
  • expect these difficulties to continue for at least 9 months

question: I have limited sight and am registered as being legally blind. I hold down a full time job in IT with a limited amount of help. . What level of Blind Person' Allowance can I claim?

question: I am unable to work due to a mental health condition. I have had this condition for several years and it is gradually worsening. I do not see any sign of respite. . Are people with mental health problems eligible for ESA?
Answers:
yes Conditions:

You can apply for ‘new style’ Employment and Support Allowance (ESA) if you’re under State Pension age and you have a disability or health condition that affects how much you can work.

question: I have recently moved to a different country with my three year old son. My ex remains in the UK. . Does the fact that I live abroad mean that I can't claim Child Maintenance?

yes Conditions:

Your security bond will remain in force for 2 years after the death of the person you’re a deputy for unless there’s a court order cancelling it.

question: I am currently getting Reduced Earnings Allowance and really not an a regular work and will be soon turn 66 . Will I still be eligible for Reduced Earnings Allowance ?

no Conditions:
  • you reach State Pension age

question: My brother has sadly been involved in a car accident that has left him in a coma. He was living with his partner but they were not married. He never got round to making a will. Answers:
yes Conditions:

You can only apply to the court if there’s a major disagreement about a serious decision which cannot be agreed any other way. There are general rules and examples in the Mental Capacity Act 2005 Code of Practice.

Check if someone has an attorney or deputy acting for them before you apply.

question: I am a freelance graphic designer. I recently contracted COVID-19 and I am now recovering with it. It rendered me bedridden and I couldn't work. . Now that I am taking freelance work again, can I still claim Employment and Support Allowance?

yes Conditions:

You can usually work while you are claiming ESA if both of the following apply:

question: My grandmother has a large estate. She is currently suffering from dementia, but has indicated that she would like me to manage her estate upon her death. question: My uncle was diagnosed with stage 4 mesothelioma after getting asbestos exposure during his work period. His employers have been very irresponsible to support him. question: My income has recently reduced from £60,000 to £45,000 because I am now working less hours. I have a child aged 7. I was not claiming child benefit before due to my income. I now want to start claiming again. . How long after submitting the form will it take for my payments to restart?

Can you get financial assistance with the cost of making a lasting power of attorney?
Answers:
yes Conditions:

You can apply for a reduction if you earn less than £12,000. You might also be able to apply for an exemption if you’re on certain benefits, such as Income Support.

question: I am 16. My grandparents mentioned a few years ago that they had set up a trust fund for me. They have now sadly died and I want to find out if they did set up a fund or not. . What information do I need to provide to find out the provider of my trust fund?

question: I am 34 and live in Scotland with my 9 year old daughter. I have an existing CM Arrangement with my ex-husband, adjudicated by the High Court in Edinburgh. question: We have been married for 20 years and have four kids. Recently we decided to end our relationship. We decided to keep two kids each but are having issues on dividing up the assets . We couldn't come to an agreement on dividing up the assets. Can we go to court and get them to decide?

yes Conditions:

You must attend a meeting about mediation before you can apply to the court to decide - except in certain cases (if there’s been domestic abuse, for example).

question: I have just found out that I am pregnant. Me and my husband are really excited and we want to both be off work together to care for it at the start. Currently we both work full time, 40 hours per week. . How many paid weeks can we have off work?

yes Conditions:

question: My ex-husband is defaulting on our child maintenance agreement. I am the parent with primary care of our daughter and he is currently in Germany with the army. . Can an absent parent in the army be made to pay child maintenance while the are abroad?

question: I am a homeowner with a mortgage and currently receive Universal Credit. I want to see if there is any additional help for me to pay my mortgage . What interest rate applies to a Support for Mortgage Interest loan?

You can apply for an NHS bursary from your 5th year on the 5 or 6 year undergraduate course or from your 2nd year on the 4 year accelerated graduate course.

Your total bursary amount depends on your household income. This can be either your own income, your parents’ income, or that of your partner, spouse or civil partner.

You must be accepted for a place on a full or part-time NHS-funded course which will lead to you registering as a doctor or dentist.

You may be eligible for an NHS bursary even if you’ve already had public funding for higher education.

If you’ve had an NHS bursary and want to change professions, you may also be eligible.

question: I am the finance director of an electronic components firm, which currently employs over 100 people. Due to an oversight by my predecessor we had, until this year, neglected to claim for Employment  Allowance, despite meeting the required threshold of Class 1 NI liability for most of the past 6 years. . Can we make a claim for the allowance against our previous years' NI liabilities?

I am a medical student currently studying at an English university and living nearby. The next year of my course will involve a placement in Germany for 3 months out of the 12. . Can I claim travel expenses for the overseas placement?
Answers:
yes Conditions:

You must attend an overseas institution for at least half of each academic term. This period of study can be compulsory or optional.

question: I am a computer science student studying for a degree at the University of London, England. My course is funded privately, and I do not currently receive payments through student finance. I have been offered an Erasmus work placement in France as part of my final year. . Can I claim support for my overseas trip through Student Finance, even though I don't currently have an account?

I am 19, British and hoping to start a BA degree course at the University of Birmingham in the near future. This will be a three year course, run at the normal rate, and they will charge the full amount permitted for tuition fees. . What is the present upper limit for tuition fee loans?

I am 22, a citizen of France and have lived in the UK for a little over seven years, having "settled status". I now wish to begin a course of study leading to a first (BSc) degree, which will be taught full-time over four years at a UK University. . Am I eligible for both a tuition fee loan and help with living costs?

I am an employee at a catering services firm in Birmingham, and have lodged a grievance with my employer with the help of my trade union representative. We have been verbally assured by the company's HR manager that they "follow the Acas Code of Practice". . Is the company in fact obliged to follow the Acas Code of Practice?

I am the managing director of a professional services firm, and recently had to discipline an employee for misconduct. This employee then filed a grievance against the sanctions imposed, and I am currently writing up our decision to reject this. One witness to the misconduct has, however, requested to be kept anonymous. . Is it permissible to omit the witness's name when writing to the parties involved?

I am 17 years old, and currently work as an apprentice carpenter in a local joinery. My contract stipulates a 30-hour minimum work week, with payment by the hour rather than by finished work. . What right to take rest breaks do I have as an under-18?
Answers:
a 30 minute rest break Conditions:
  • a 30 minute rest break if they work more than 4.5 hours (if possible this should be one continuous break)

question: I am 55 and work as a delivery driver for a shipping company, where I am paid a fixed rate per delivery and am expected to be available at short notice. My employer claims that the "mobile" nature of the work means that I am not entitled to the three standard types of rest break. . Can I claim the 3 general types of rest break?

I own and manage a very small biotechnology startup company, which currently has only four employees. Owing to our small size I run our monthly payroll myself, and file the necessary reports with HMRC. . As we are so small, is it possible to make reports and payments at wider intervals than monthly?
Answers:
yes Conditions:

If you’re a small employer that expects to pay less than £1,500 a month, you can arrange to pay quarterly - contact HMRC’s payment enquiry helpline.

question: I am a newly-qualified accountant who has just started work at a small startup company. This has been in existence for just over 2 years and appears (so far) to have kept correct records of its employee payments and dealings with HMRC through the PAYE system. . Is there a list of records which HMRC requires to be kept, and for how long they need to be kept?

I am the managing director of a package delivery company based in London. Recently one of my employees was attacked by a dog while making a delivery, and has so far been absent for 14 days for medical treatment. He had already booked 4 days of annual leave on dates within this period of absence. . Should my employee's annual leave days be paid at the same SSP rate as the lost work days?

I own and run an electronic components factory with just over 200 employees. One of my employees is currently absent through illness, and has requested SSP. I am sceptical as to whether she is actually sick. . How soon can I request medical proof of this employee's sickness?

I am a first-year undergraduate study for a degree in medicine, on a course funded by the NHS. I have been resident in the UK for the whole of my 18 years. . Is my household income independent to determining how large an NHS Bursary I can get?

I am a lifelong UK resident and have applied for a place on a NHS-funded degree course which will ultimately lead to my qualification as a dentist. I am strongly considering applying for an NHS Bursary. . Should I wait for my place to be confirmed before making my NHS bursary application?

I am an employee at a biotechnology startup in Epsom, England. I draw an annual salary of £44,000, am paid monthly and at present have accrued over 20 days of holiday entitlement. I hope to take 10 days (two working weeks) of these in a single block. . Is there a formula for calculating the amount of notice I need to give before taking leave?
Answers: twice as long as the amount of leave a worker wants to take, plus 1 day Conditions:

question: I am the managing director of a financial services firm based in the City of London. Recently one of our senior staff members handed in his resignation, and is now commencing the six weeks notice period stipulated in his contract. He also has 24 days of leave entitlement accrued, which we would prefer that he didn't take during his notice period. . Is it possible to "buy back" his leave entitlement during this notice period?

I am 22, and work part-time at a local health food co-operative. I have no formal contract of employment, which I understand classifies me as a worker rather than an employee. . Am I still entitled to be paid the National Minimum Wage?

I own and run a fruit farm in Kent, which currently employs four full-time staff and a further 16 workers on a part-time, seasonal basis. I am diligent about paying the correct wage rates and have decided to do my own accounts and record keeping to save money. . For how long am I required to keep records of my monthly payroll calculations?
Answers:
at least 6 years Conditions:
  • were created on or after 1 April 2021
  • still had to be kept on 31 March 2021 under the previous rule that records must be kept for 3 years

question: I own and operate a small business in Scotland, with almost 50 employees. We run payroll on a monthly basis, via the PAYE system. Various benefits are given to employees, including phones and company cars. . When is the deadline for paying the preceding year's Class 1A contributions on these benefits?
Answers:
22 july Conditions:

You need to pay contributions on work benefits by 22 July each year for the previous tax year. You’ll need to pay by 19 July if paying by post.

question: I own and manage a football club in Cardiff, Wales. We have around 100 employees, including players whom we compensate via the PAYE system along with our other staff. One of our players is approaching his 10th anniversary with the club, and we are organising a sporting testimonial for him. . Are we required to pay Class 1A contributions on income from our players testimonial events?
Answers:
yes Conditions:
  • more than £100,000
  • not in the player’s contract

question: I own and run a SME employing just over 50 people. One of my long-term employees has given notice that she intends to claim both statutory maternity leave and statutory maternity pay, but so far has not provided proof of pregnancy. . Do I have to grant her SMP and SML requests if she doesn't provide this evidence by her SML start date?

I am the HR director for a firm in the construction industry. I have received verbal notice from an employee that she wishes to claim both SML and SMP, but have calculated that her earnings and employment history do not meet the required thresholds to grant her request for the latter. . What form do I have to use to reject her SMP request?

I own and manage a small engineering firm in Newark, England. I recently received a priority attachment of earnings order regarding a divorced employee whose has been delinquent in paying child maintenance. . Who do I need to notify if the employee is actually earning less than the protected earnings rate given in the order?
Answers: the centralised attachment of earning payments (caps) office

question: I work as a salaried (plus commissions) employee at a car dealership in Birmingham. I have unpaid debts to a finance company, who obtained a CCJ against me. The court has now sent a non-priority attachment of earnings order to both my employer and myself. . Can my employer deduct from my commissions and performance-related bonuses as well as my base salary?

I own and manage a small pottery, in which employees hand-craft crockery and ornaments which are customised to the purchaser's individual preferences. I pay a fixed rate for each finished ornament, but also specify the minimum amount of time which must be spent on each piece. . Is this type of work considered to be output work or time work for minimum wage purposes?

I run a small hardware store in Birmingham, England. Most of my employees are paid an annual salary and bonus, which fully complies with minimum wage requirements. However, the unpredictable nature of retail means that overtime hours are frequently required (in excess of those stipulated in their contracts of employment). . Does the minimum wage rate also apply to any overtime hours that an employee works?

I am 20, and currently in the middle of the first term of the final year of a degree course at a college in the west of England. After attending a routine medical check-up yesterday I was told that I have a malignant melanoma, which will require both immediate surgery and then 6-8 weeks of chemotherapy. The latter will likely seriously impair my ability to study effectively. . If I suspend my studies for the duration of the chemotherapy, can I get a maintenance loan to cover my needs during the period of suspension?

I am a first-year undergraduate student at a university in London. I'm 4 weeks into my second semester and struggling quite badly with my studies, and after a long consultation with my tutors I have decided to leave my course immediately. I have both maintenance and tuition fee loans with Student Finance England. . How much of my tuition fee loan will I need to repay to Student Finance England if I do quit?
Answers: 50% of the loan for the year

question: I am 53, a UK national and have worked for my employer for a little over 10 years. However, as of this morning my employer has been declared insolvent and has asked me to take immediate redundancy. . How much redundancy pay am I entitled to from my former employer?
Answers: one and half week’s pay for each full year you were employed

question: I am 37, and for the past year have worked without taking any of my holiday entitlement from my employer of 7 years standing, in an ultimately futile effort to help them stave off insolvency. Nevertheless, my employer is set to be declared insolvent later this week. . If I am made redundant, can I claim payment for all the unused holiday entitlement?

I live in Brighton, England and have just had an offer to purchase my first home, in a nearby village, accepted by the seller. We expect to exchange contracts on August 23rd 2020, for an agreed price of £390,000. . How much SDLT should I expect to pay, as a first time buyer?

I am an expatriate Uk citizen, who retired to Spain three years ago and has not returned since. I do, however, own the freehold on my old UK home and lease it to a tenant, and am now considering the purchase of two additional rental properties there as an investment. . Are the standard rates of SDLT for UK residents also applicable to purchases by non-residents?

I have just purchased my first home, a 1960s two-bedroomed detached house in a village in West Yorkshire, England which I bought with a mortgage from a building society. Despite its age this house does not appear to be registered with the land registry. . If I want to register the property myself, what documentation will I need to provide?
Answers: a completed ‘whole of registered title assent’ form Conditions:

question: I have just inherited the lease on a property near Devizes, England from my late grandfather, who sadly passed away last month. The lease appears to have just over six years left to run. . Do I need to register the change of ownership of the lease with the land registry?

I own a lease on a small apartment in a block in London, England, and have been a tenant there for over 15 years. The lease is, however, due to expire in three months time and I am worried that the property company which owns the freehold may evict me. . Does the expiry of the lease also void my tenancy agreement with the landlord/freeholder?

I own the freeholds on three properties in Rhayader, Wales, which I am keen to sell to raise funds. Two of these are subdivided into flats, and have resident leaseholders who have expressed interest in acquiring their freeholds in the past. . Do I have to give these leaseholders first refusal on any sale of the freehold(s)?

I am a private investigator, currently working for a finance company performing deep background checks on high value loan applicants. I am currently investigating an applicant who is offering a house as collateral for a loan. . What entry on the land registry tell me whether or not there is outstanding mortgage finance owing on the property?

I am interested in purchasing a property in a village in Somerset, and have been assured by the estate agent handling it that the property has increased substantially in value since it last changed hands. I have tried to verify this myself by consulting the land registry, but cannot find a corresponding entry in the online register! . Is there a way that I can consult the index map directly, to see if this information does in fact exist?

I own and manage a farm in the Cotswolds and am currently renovating on old stable block and adding a new paddock. The latter requires removing a tree, which a conservation group has persuaded my local council to issue a tree preservation order on. . How long do I have from the date of decision in which to lodge an appeal against this order?

I am a property developer who is attempting to renovate an old apartment building in central Manchester. In order to do this, I hired a tree surgeon to pollard a tree which stands in the central courtyard; however, some ornithologists have managed to obtain a tree preservation order preventing this. . If I appeal, should I sent my documents to the local council or to the planning inspectorate?
Answers: the council who made the decision and the planning inspectorate.

question: I own a four-bedroomed family home on the outskirts of Nuneaton, England, which I am now about to sell. This has been the main residence of myself and my partner and children for the past 18 years, and has a total footprint of just under 400 square meters if the garden is included. . Will I need to pay Capital Gains Tax on the sale of this house?
Answers:
no Conditions:
  • you have not let part of it out or used part of it for business only

question: I live in Scotland, am a professional landlord and am currently in the process of buying a new property to add to my portfolio. The sale is being done through an estate agent, and he has just provided an updated Energy Performance Certificate for the property (the previous owner not having obtained one). . Am I legally required to show this EPC to any prospective tenants?

I have been a tenant of a housing association for over 6 years, and 2 months ago made an application to purchase the 2-bedroomed flat in which I reside under Right to Acquire. The landlord has now replied with an offer, but I consider this to have been unfairly determined . Who can I request an independent third party valuation of the property?
Answers: a district valuer from hm revenue & customs

question: I have been a housing association tenant in Bradford, England for two years and three months, and was a council tenant for the eight years preceding that period. I am now looking to acquire the house in which I currently reside from the landlord, who acquired it in late 2004. . Does my council tenancy count towards the three year qualifying period for Right to Acquire?

I am a keen sea angler and own a 12-metre open boat, based in Falmouth, Cornwall. In addition to fishing I also use the boat to conduct tours of the local coastline for interested tourists. . Which category should be boat be registered under on the UK Ship Register?
Answers:
part 1 Conditions:
  • a commercial boat, unless you plan to use it for fishing

question: I live in Reedham, Norfolk and have just acquired a 15-seater, second hand riverboat. I intend to use this both for my own pleasure and as a passenger-carrying alternative to the local chain ferry across the Yare, during periods in which it is not in service. I have acquired a BSS certificate and a boatmaster's license. . Which authority do I now need to register the boat with?

I own a large (ca. 1,500 square metres of sales space) high-street electronics store in a town in southern England, which operates a free like-for-like takeback service when selling new products to customers, in addition to taking back any 'very small WEEE' items that they bring in. . Is it required to take back 'very small WEEE' from non-customers too?

I own an electronics retailing business which now operates entirely online, having just sold off our former high street store (and its WEEE takeback facility) to a competitor.  We currently sell around £19,000,000 of electronics goods each year. . Are we eligible to use the Distributor Takeback Scheme for WEEE disposal, or will we need to set up a new collection point of our own?
Answers: have your own take back service

question: I own and run a small farm in rural Oxfordshire, on the outskirts of Russell's Water. Earlier this year I applied for permission to remove a hedgerow which forms the boundary between two of my fields; however, my local council demurred and instead sent me a hedgerow retention notice. . If I want to appeal against this notice to the planning inspectorate, what documentation do I need to provide?
Answers: a copy of your original application

question: I live in a small cottage in the Mendips, which lies at one end of a valley whose land is owned by a single farmer who recently removed a hedgerow without obtaining permission. After both I and a local conservation charity had complained about this the local council issued him with a hedgerow replacement notice. He has not complied with this, however, and is now launching an appeal to the planning inspectorate. . Will I be able to comment on his appeal if I don't have access to internet?

I purchased my current family home in Norwich, England from the local council 9 years ago under the right-to-buy scheme. With my children having now grown up and left home my partner and I are now looking to sell the house and retire to something a little smaller. . Can I now sell my home to whomever I like on the open market?
Answers:
no Conditions:
  • a national park
  • an area of outstanding natural beauty
  • an area the government says is rural for Right to Buy

question: I have recently begun letting out my former family home to tenants, and have just had to perform my first right-to-rent check. The tenant's documents appear to be in order, and I have made high quality photocopies of them as directed. . For how long do I need to keep my copies of these documents?
Answers: for the time they’re your tenants and for one year after

question: I am a letting agent working for an agency in Coventry, England. One of our client landlords has asked us to perform right-to-rent checking as part of our upcoming background check on a prospective tenant, but this is not specifically referenced in the current terms and conditions of our current contract. . Can we skip the current term and include this check later?

I live in a small village in Somerset, and have a neighbour whose privet hedge has been allowed to grow to such a height that it completely blocks the light to my rear garden, preventing me from growing anything. I complained about this to the local council, but they have declined to issue a remedial notice. . How long do I have in which to lodge an appeal against this refusal with the planning inspectorate?

I own a home in a rural area of Wales, which is currently surrounded on 3 sides by high Leylandii hedges. Despite the fact that I have no immediate neighbours, I have received a remedial order from the local council ordering me to drastically prune them back.  I have written to the planning inspectorate to appeal this decision. . How long will I have to wait for the planning inspectorate to make their decision?

I live in a village in SW England and am a keen recreational walker. A nearby farm has recently changed hands, and the new owner is refusing to allow a formerly permissive path across his land to be used as a right of way. However, I have uncovered evidence that this may have been a formal right of way in the past. . Can I gain access to this (former) right on way on this basis?

I live in England and frequently backpack in the hills during my vacation periods. A favourite area of mine has recently been designated as "open access land", and I am considering camping there in the near future. . Is there a general right to camp on open access land?

I own a house in Walsall, England which is currently partitioned into a house in multiple occupation, for four tenants all on periodic assured shorthold tenancies. All four have been in residence for over a year, i.e. from before the coronavirus pandemic. . How much notice to quit do I need currently need to give my tenants?

I own and live in a 3-bedroomed flat in central Manchester, and rent one of these bedrooms out to a lodger in return for payment on a weekly basis. We do not currently have a formal tenancy agreement of any kind, and I am unsure of my rights regarding eviction. . How are "lodgers" classified legally?

I am currently sharing a rented house with my brother, who is also my next of kin. This has been put up for sale by our landlord, and we are considering a shared purchase of the freehold. . If I want to make sure that my brother inherits the property if I die, would we be better off buying as "beneficial joint tenants" or "tenants in common"?

I currently part-own a house as a tenant-in-common with a long-term friend, who has now accepted my proposal of marriage! We would thus like to convert to being joint tenants on an equal basis. . How much does it cost for converting our ownership to joint tenancy?

I am 23, work as a trainee estate agent and live in Leeds, England. I share a rented house with two other people, both of whom are full time students in higher education. . Am I required to pay council tax, and how much discount am I eligible for if so?

I am the owner-occupier of a house in Birmingham, where I live with my wife. My wife became a paraplegic as a result of a traffic accident three years ago, and this has required us to extend our house to provide extra storage space for her mobility aids. . If the extension moves our house into a higher council tax band, can I claim a discount on the basis of my wife's disability?
Answers:
yes Conditions:

The property must be the main home of at least 1 disabled person. This can be an adult or a child - it does not have to be the person responsible for paying the Council Tax.

question: I own and manage a farm in rural Kent, which currently covers 520 hectares. I recently built a new extension to a listed building (a stable block) on my land, but have received an enforcement notice from my local council to remove it on the grounds that I violated the terms of the relevant planning permission. . Can I lodge an appeal against this notice by post?

I rent an apartment in a converted schoolhouse in a small village in Somerset. About four months ago a neighbour constructed a huge unsightly fence around his property without obtaining the proper planning permission. After I notified the local council, he was served with an enforcement notice two weeks ago ordering him to remove it. He has not complied, and last week filed an appeal against the notice. . How long do I have to submit comments on his appeal before it gets decided?

I am letting agent who is currently representing a new landlord who wishes to rent out his former home as an HMO to tenants on assured shorthold tenancies. I recently signed the first tenancy agreement for this, and took possession of the tenant's deposit. . What is the deadline for placing this deposit in a TDP scheme?

I am a prospective tenant, who is considering taking out an assured shorthold tenancy on a 2-bedroom flat in Oxford. I will be unable to finance the required deposit myself; however, my parents have agreed to pay part of it for me. . Will contributions to my deposit by my parents be treated differently from my own money?

I own the freehold on a terraced row of small shops in a suburb of Leeds, England, and have an office within the same building. I am looking to renovate the terrace, and as part of this process I applied for permission to remove the partition wall between two of the shops to create a single, larger unit. However, this permission was refused by the local council. . If I appeal this matter to the planning inspectorate, what documents do I need to include?

I live in a small village in the Quantocks, and am active in the Campaign to Protect Rural England. Last year a local shopkeeper attempted to gain planning permission to install some hideous steel shutters on the front of his shop as a security measure; however, this was refused after opposing comments by myself and several others. However, I have now been notified that he intends to appeal this refusal to the planning inspectorate. . Can I comment on the storekeeper's appeal to the planning inspectorate?

My uncle owns a transport limited company . His father died  as he was in the process of making self assessment returns for the tax year 2020-2021. He wishes to do the returns online. . What is the deadline for the 2020-2021 if he files returns online?

My employer has missed paying the self assessment tax return on time because the accountant resigned . He has managed to file the returns late by 3 months. . How much penalty Will he pay after the delay?
Answers:
£100 Conditions:

You’ll pay a late filing penalty of £100 if your tax return is up to 3 months late. You’ll have to pay more if it’s later, or if you pay your tax bill late.

question: I am owed a small amount of money from a debtor which I would like to chase as a matter of principle. I live in London. The debt is a result of a private loan I made to a friend which remains unpaid . Does my location have any bearing on whether I can bankrupt my debtor?

My mortgage lender has started a house repossession action against me . I have received a defense form . I will use it to explain to the court the reasons why my house should not be repossessed. . When am i supposed  to return it?

I live in England . I have an unpaid mortgage due to the change of my income. I was hospitalized the whole of last year due to long terms covid Complications and lost my job.The lender has taken repossession action against me. . Can i get a legal aid?
Answers:
yes Conditions:

If you’re on a low income you may be able to get legal aid.

question: My partner and I are in our late twenties and both of us work full time. We are not married but have a civil partnership that has lasted for nearly 8 years. We have no immediate plans to marry. . Can we claim married couple's allowance?

My husband of forty years and I claim married couples' allowance. We are both retired but are very active in our local community. A lot of our income goes towards local charities. . Do we get a tax break due to our charitable donations?

My wife and i would like to have the windows replaced on our house. It seemed easy at first but we are confused as to what we need to do about Building Regulations. . Can our contractor handle this for us?
Answers:
yes Conditions:

You do not need to get approval yourself if you use someone registered with a competent person scheme.

You do not need to apply for approval yourself if the work is not covered by building regulations, or if it’s carried out by someone who’s registered with a competent person scheme.

question: I am a part time builder and i have decided to do the work on my house myself. I am not part of the Competent Person scheme so will need to apply for Building regulations. . Where and how do i apply?
My grandfather has terminal lung cancer and has been given only 6 months to live. He has a lifetime allowance  of £990,000. He is 60 years old. . Can he be paid a tax free lampsum of all his money?

My mother is about to receive her state and personal pension. She wants all the taxes paid . She wants to know which pension  can HMRC or pension provider use to pay off the taxes. . What is a document proof to show what is paid?
I have sold my house . It is not eligible for private resident relief. I am compiling my documents to pay the capital gain tax. . How long do I have to report and pay the tax?
I am a UK citizen and I own a house in South Africa. I live there for 3 months of the year. It is my perfect choice for a holiday break. . Can i nominate it for tax relief?

During the COVID19 Pandemic it was deemed that I should work from home. This now means that my household bills have increased as i am using the utilities more and more. . Can I claim tax relief on my increased utilities cost?
Hi there. I have racked up a number of expenses this year that I should get a tax rebate on. I am hoping HMRC will send me a big fat cheque. . How will I receive the money due to me?
Answers: make any adjustments needed through your tax code

question: I have a debtor that owes me £10,000. The debt is from seven years ago. I would like to serve them with a statutory demand for non-payment. . Will I be able to do this?

I have received a statutory demand for a debt for £1,000. I do not think this is fair as the work done was not adequate for the fee. I want to challenge this demand. . Where do I make a challenge on this demand.
Answers: the court named on your statutory demand

question: My company is currently registered for the flat rate scheme. I am expecting revenue to increase to £200,000 next year. . Must I leave the flat rate scheme next year as this is only an expectation?
My business is VAT-registered. This business works in the accountancy industry. I am interested in registering for the flat rate scheme. . What flat rate will I have to pay on my revenue?
Answers:
16.5% Conditions:

You’re classed as a ‘limited cost business’ if your goods cost less than either:

  • 2% of your turnover
  • £1,000 a year (if your costs are more than 2%)

question: I have just sold my house for more than I bought it for 5 years ago. I want know the amount of capital gains tax I am supposed to pay HMRC. . Do I have to pay capital gains tax?
Answers:
no Conditions:
  • your home
  • occupied by a dependent relative - find out more in the guidance on Private Residence Relief

question: My mother has sold her house property . It was not her main home and had let part of it. She wishes to report to the HMRC about the sell and the gains for taxes purposes. . How much time does she have to report?

I have lived in England for ten years and paid tax on my full time earnings. I am due to be transferred to a branch in Glasgow. I do not know if there is anything I need to do tax wise. . Is there a difference between tax brackets in Scotland and in England?

I work from home in the IT business. I divide my time between a home in Glasgow and one in London. I have never mentioned this on my tax declarations. . Does it make a difference that I live in two different places and should I declare it?
I am a small business owner and VAT can be a bit of a headache. I have heard about the annual scheme for VAT. . Do I qualify for VAT Annual Accounting Scheme?
Answers:
yes Conditions:
  • your estimated VAT taxable turnover is £1.35 million or less in the next 12 months
  • you’re a VAT-registered business

question: Good morning. I have just joined a business that does Annual VAT accounting. This is the first time I have come across it and I want to make sure i get things right. . What is the deadline for getting my VAT returns in?
Answers: once a year, 2 months after the end of your accounting period

question: My husband and our children moved to our - we thought quiet - new home six months ago. Recently there have been a lot of roadworks in the area. We were not informed of this before we moved in and it is distressing us. . Do we have recourse to any sort of authority to make a complaint about the noise?

I have been living under a flight path for the last ten years and was aware of it when I moved in. Initially it did not bother me but recently the airport has been expanded and another runway built. This has significantly increased the noise that I am exposed to. I was not informed at all about the proposal to build a new runway. . I feel that the new runway has decreased the value of my house, due to the increase in noise. Is this a legitimate complaint?
I gave my wife a house property as a gift of our marriage . She has decided to sell it so that she can get some extra income . . Will the money she will recieve liable to capital gain tax?

I have inherited a lot of valuable antiques and jewelry from my grandmother . I have some financial constrains after the loss of my job. I would like to dispose them off and get some profit. . When do I have to report my capital gains by?
Answers: by 31 december in the tax year after you made the gain. Conditions:

question: I am a full time employee and I have invested in the employee share scheme. I have saved now £18000 for the last 3 years. . Can i transfer my shares to ISA?

My mother wishes to have a savings plan. She wishes to set up an ISA and put her shares in it. She is concerned that when she fills in her annual self assessment she will have to declare all the ISA share interests. . Does income from an ISA have to be declared in a tax return?
